Antisocial.title: Antisocial
Antisocial.description: You find the presence of others uncomfortable, so much so that it is immediately obvious to those around you. Your preference for solitude causes you to behave in a manner that might best be described as rude. If you take the 2 point version of this Disadvantage, you suffer a penalty of -1k0 to all Social Skill Rolls. For 4 points, the penalty is -1k1. This Disadvantage is worth 1 additional point to Crab characters.
Antisocial.output_text: You suffer a penalty of {rank[text]} to all Social Skill Rolls.

input.default_option: Choose the strength of the effect...

Ascetic.title: Ascetic
Ascetic.description: You have no taste for or interest in material things, and this minimalist attidute has impacted how others view you. Your School Outfit includes only weapons, armor, clothing, necessary tools of the trade for your profession (such as a scroll satchel for shugenja), and nothing else. Any time you would be awarded Glory as a result of your actions, you receive only half the normal amount. Coupled with the normal restriction for Monks in gaining Glory, ascetic monk characters would only gain one quarter the normal amount of Glory. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Dragon and monk characters.
Ascetic.output_text:
Your School Outfit includes only weapons, armor, clothing, and necessary tools of the trade for your profession.
Any time you would be awarded Glory as a result of your actions, you receive only half the normal amount. This stacks with the normal restriction for Monks in gaining Glory, resulting in only one quarter of the normal amount for Ascetic Monks.

Bad Eyesight.title: Bad Eyesight
Bad Eyesight.description: Your eyesight is exceptionally poor, whether as a result of some medical condition or even from a missing eye. You suffer a penalty of -1k1 to all ranged attack rolls and to any Perception-based rolls.
Bad Eyesight.output_text: You suffer a penalty of -1k1 to all ranged attack rolls and to any Perception-based rolls.

Bad Fortune.title: Bad Fortune
Bad Fortune.description: Kharma is a powerful force, and sometimes it is a destructive one as well. There is something unpleasant in store for you, and you may have no idea what it is until is it far too late. You can also create a custom Bad Fortune if desired. You should discuss Bad Fortunes with your GM before selecting.

1.hovertext: Somwhere, someone is madly in love with you, and will go to any lengths to sabotage your romantic interests, even politically arranged marriages, in order to ensure that you remain available, for them.

2.hovertext: You have a birthmark of some sort that appears on a visible portion of your body. Others regard it as a clear mark of bad fortune (which is Rokugan, it is), and give you a very wide berth.

3.hovertext: One of your eyes is discolored. People avoid looking you in the eyes at all costs, and some believe your very presence invites evil spirits.

4.hovertext: You are allergic to a common substance, something you come into contact with regularly, such as silk, cotton, or suchi. Its presence breaks you out in a very uncomfortable rash, which in turn makes others react poorly to your presence.

5.hovertext: At some point in your future, you will fail an extremely important dice roll in a spectacularly disastrous fashion. The GM will decide when this happens, and no mechanical effect will allow you to overcome it or to circumvent it.

6.hovertext: Someone somewhere in another Clan hates you, and wishes to see you dead. You have no idea who they are or why they hate you, but you will very soon.

7.hovertext: You possess a spiritual weakness that makes you extremely susceptible to the Shadowlands Taint. You suffer a penalty of -1k0 to any roll made to resist acquiring the Taint. Only members of the Unicorn Clan may take this Disadvantage, and they receive 4 points for it.

8.hovertext: You are cursed to betray the one you love the most, just as the first Yogo was cursed by Fu Leng himself. You may only take this Advantage if you are a member of the Scorpion Clan, or of the Yogo bloodline.

Bad Health.title: Bad Health
Bad Health.description: You suffer from a chronic medical condition that constantly renders you weak and susceptible to both illness and injury. Your Earth Ring is considered one rank lower for the purposes of determining Wound Ranks and for resisting diseases.
Bad Health.output_text: Your Earth Ring is considered one rank lower for the purposes of determining Wound Ranks and for resisting diseases.

Bitter Betrothal.title: Bitter Betrothal
Bitter Betrothal.description: You have been promised to another, or perhaps are already married, and neither of you are at all pleased with the situation. Your spouse despises you, but he or she at least has the decorum to manage your estate properly... for the most part. Your mutual dislike, however, can result in tremendous difficulty with even simple domestic or bureaucratic tasks. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Imperial characters.
Bitter Betrothal.output_text: Your spouse despises you. This can result in tremendous difficulty with even simple domestic or bureaucratic tasks.

Blackmailed.title: Blackmailed
Blackmailed.description: Someone out there knows of some dark secret of yours, or some horrible indiscretion you committed in a moment of weakness. What's worse, they intend to make you pay for it. The cost of this Disadvantage is equal to your Status Rank. The person blackmailing you will contact you periodically and require certain things of you. You must weigh these actions against the potential disgrace if your secret is discovered, and act accordingly.

Black Sheep.title: Black Sheep
Black Sheep.description: For whatever reason, your family is completely disgusted with you and your actions. You have not been cast out and made ronin, but you are no longer welcome in your own household. You may only maintain proper relations with any member of your family via the Allies Advantage, and if you attend one of your own family's Schools, you may not advance in School Rank without going to great lengths to find a willing teacher.
Black Sheep.output_text: You are no longer welcome in your own household. You may only maintain proper relations with any member of your family via the Allies Advantage, and if you attend one of your own family's Schools, you may not advance in School Rank without going to great lengths to find a willing teacher.

Blind.title: Blind
Blind.description: You possess no natural eyesight whatsoever, save for a slight abilit to determine light and dark. You suffer a penalty of -3k3 to all ranged attack rolls and -1k1 to melee attack rolls. Your base Armor TN is equal to your Reflexes Trait +5 (armor adds bonuses as normal). Your Water Ring is considered two ranks lower for the purposes of determining how far you may move as part of a Move Action. Any attempt at a Simple Move Action required an Athletics roll (TN 20) or you are knocked Prone. You may not make Perception rolls unless the GM judges that you can use senses other than sight for the roll.
Blind.output_text: You suffer a penalty of -3k3 to all ranged attack rolls and -1k1 to melee attack rolls. Your base Armor TN is equal to your Reflexes Trait +5 (armor adds bonuses as normal). Your Water Ring is considered two ranks lower for the purposes of determining how far you may move as part of a Move Action. Any attempt at a Simple Move Action required an Athletics roll (TN 20) or you are knocked Prone. You may not make Perception rolls unless the GM judges that you can use senses other than sight for the roll.

Brash.title: Brash
Brash.description: You have a notoriously short temper and are likely to answer anything you perceive as a threat with steel. If you are threatened or insulted, you must make a Willpower Trait roll (adding your Honor Rank to the total) at a TN of 25, or your will attack immediately. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Lion characters.
Brash.output_text: If you are threatened or insulted, you must make a Willpower Trait roll (adding your Honor Rank to the total) at a TN of 25, or your will attack immediately.

Can't Lie.title: Can't Lie
Can't Lie.description: You are psycholoigcally incapable of telling a lie, perhaps because it has been so thoroughly drilled into your nature by your honorable family. Not only can you not tell a lie, but if someone in your presence tells a lie and you know that it is untrue, you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll (TN 20) or immediately correct them. This can cause untold difficulty in court settings and can lead to complete disgrace if you are not careful.
Can't Lie.output_text:
You are incapable of lying.
If someone in your presence tells a lie and you know that it is untrue, you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll (TN 20) or immediately correct them.

Cast Out.title: Cast Out
Cast Out.description: You, or perhaps your entire line, were at some point denounced by an order of monks, an act that brings great shame to eve the least pious samurai. One point in this Disadvantage indicates the disapproval of a single temple, while 3 points represents a major sect within the Brotherhood of Shinsei. Monks of this sect treat you as if your Glory Rank were in fact Infamy.
Cast Out.output_text:
You, or your entire line, were at some point denounced by an order of monks, an act that brings great shame to eve the least pious samurai.
{magnitude[hovertext]}

1.hovertext: You have the disapproval of a single temple.

2.hovertext: You have the disapproval of a major sect of the Brotherhood of Shinsei.

Compulsion.title: Compulsion
Compulsion.description: There is some activity in which you are hopelessly compelled to partake. It is a ritual that is so ingrained in your behaviour that it requires a feat of will to forsake it, even in dire circumstances. This may be something illicit and addictive, such as sake or gambling, or it may be as innocuous as visiting every major temple you pass. The basic Disadvantage requires a Willpower Trait Roll of TN 15 to overcome. The TN of the roll increases by 5 for every additional point gained by the Disadvantage, to a maximum of TN 25 (4 points).
Compulsion.output_text:
Compulsion: {compulsion}
You are hopelessly drawn to follow your compulsion, and must pass a Willpower Trait Roll of {magnitude[text]} to resist it whenever an opportunity presents itself.

input.default_options: Select the TN you must overcome...

Consumed.title: Consumed
Consumed.description: You have walked the path of Shourido, and it has consumed you utterly. One of the tenets has become your existence, and you live only to enact it. These Disadvantages are worth one additional point to Spider characters.

1.hovertext: You suffer a -1k1 penalty on all Etiquette and Sincerity rolls.

2.hovertext: You cannot spend Void Points to enhance die-rolls. (You can still spend Void Points for other purposes and enhancements.)

3.hovertext: Choose one of your School Skills. Any time you use this Skill, you must make a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 20 or become lost in reverie as you seek a deeper understanding of this skill. (You can be snapped out of this reverie by pain, loud noise, shaking, etc.)

4.hovertext: Any time you encounter some topic, area of research, or new idea, no matter how trivial, scandalous, or blasphemous it might be, you must pass a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 25 to resist deciding to study it.

5.hovertext: Any time you make a Skill or Spell Casting Roll, you must call one extra Raise for no effect, or the roll will automatically fail.

6.hovertext:
You must call one extra Raise (for no effect) in order to use the Called Shot, Feint, or Disarm Maneuvres in combat.
You suffer a -1k0 penalty to any Etiquette roll.

7.hovertext: You suffer a -1k1 penalty to all Courtier and Temptation Skill Rolls.

Contrary.title: Contrary
Contrary.description: Your strong will and rigid view of the world insists not only that you develop an opinion on everything, but that you must share it at every opportunity. During any debate or dispute, or even casual conversation, you feel comelled to weigh in and attempt to persuade others to see the matter from your point of view. In any tense situation, you must succeed a Willpower Trait Roll to avoid taking action, whether to resolve a conflict physically or simply to interject into an argument. The TN for this roll can vary widely, and should be determined by the GM (typically somewhere between 5 and 25). This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Imperial and courtier characters.
Contrary.output_text: During any debate or dispute, or even casual conversation, you feel comelled to weigh in and attempt to persuade others to see the matter from your point of view. In any tense situation, you must succeed a Willpower Trait Roll to avoid taking action, whether to resolve a conflict physically or simply to interject into an argument. The TN for this roll can vary widely, and should be determined by the GM (typically somewhere between 5 and 25).

Cursed By The Realm.title: Cursed By The Realm
Cursed By The Realm.description: The influence of the spirit realms can be felt rhoughout the mortal realm of Ningen-do, and for whatever reason, the essence of one realm in particular has marked you as a foe of all that emanate from that realm. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to shugenja characters.

1.hovertext: You suffer a penalty of -1k1 to all Animal Handling rolls.

2.hovertext: The hungry dead crave your life essense above all others. All gaki and other hungry dead will attack you before any other available target, not matter the cost.

3.hovertext: Any roll you make to resist the Shadowlands Taint suffers a penalty of -1k1.

4.hovertext: Any roll you make against a spirit of any kind suffers a penalty of -1k1.

5.hovertext: When unoccupied by physical activity or social interaction, you tend to lapse into a trance-like state that causes you to suffer a penalty of -1k0 to all Perception-based rolls.

6.hovertext: Trickster spirits plague you, and at least once a month you are the victim of some elaborate, cruel prank by some malicious spirit.

7.hovertext: While within a temple devoted to the Heavens (any Fortune, the Kami, the Elemental Dragons, the Sun, or the Moon), the TNs of all your rolls are increased by +10.

8.hovertext: At the sight of a wounded opponent, you are overcome with bloodlust and must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll (TN 15) or immediately attack the wounded party.

9.hovertext: You may not possess any Advantages or abilities that specifically reference ancestral links (e.g. Inheritance).

10.hovertext: You are plagued with horrific nightmares, making sleep difficult. You require 10 hours of sleep to regain Void Points, rather than the normal 8.

Dark Fate.title: Dark Fate
Dark Fate.description: There is a destiny of tremendous significance in store for you, and sadly it is not an illustrious one. Before your death, you will usher tremendous darkness into the world in some way. Perhaps you will allow family secrets to fall into the hands of enemies, or perhaps you will allow the Great Kaiu Wall to fall to the Shadowlands. Destiny protexts those for whom it has great plans, even if they do not desire it. Once per session, when you suffer Wounds that would kill you, you are instead reduced to one Wound.
Dark Fate.output_text:
Before your death, you will usher tremendous darkness into the world in some way. Perhaps you will allow family secrets to fall into the hands of enemies, or perhaps you will allow the Great Kaiu Wall to fall to the Shadowlands.
Destiny protexts those for whom it has great plans, even if they do not desire it. Once per session, when you suffer Wounds that would kill you, you are instead reduced to one Wound.

Dark Secret.title: Dark Secret
Dark Secret.description: You possess some horrific secret that could lead not only to your ruination, but perhaps others in your family as well. It may be something terrible you have learned about your family that you alone know (if a venerated ancestor was secretly a dishonorable buffoon), or something you personally have done (you may be a member of the Kolat or Gozoku). If your secret is exposed, you may be required to commit seppuku or possibly even be executed. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to ninja characters.
Dark Secret.output_text:
You possess some horrific secret that could lead to your (and potentially also your family's) ruination if it ever got out.
Secret: {secret}

Dependant.title: Dependant
Dependant.description: Someone who is largely incapable of defending themselves requires you to look after them. This may be an elderly relative, a naive spouse, or a small child. The point value of this Disadvantage varies depending upon how helpless the individual is, and how frequently they appear in the campaign. A small child completely dependant upon you for everything might cost 5 or 6 points, while a spouse who is independent but whom you must consider before all major decisions might be worth 2 or 3 points.

input.placeholder: (Completely dependent, must be consulted before major decisions, etc.)

Dishonored.title: Dishonored
Dishonored.description: You have been dishonored so spectacularly that your name has been removed from your family's records, and most within the family act as if you were dead. However, the Clan has granted you the opportunity to wash away your dishonor if you perish in battle. This custom, which started with the Lion Clan, is known as the Deathseeked tradition. You possess Status Rank 1 and may not gain Status so long as you possess this Disadvantage.
Dishonored.output_text:
You have been dishonored so spectacularly that most within your family act as if you are dead. However, the Clan has granted you the opportunity to wash away your dishonor if you perish in battle.
You possess Status Rank 1 and may not gain Status so long as you possess this Disadvantage.

Disbeliever.title: Disbeliever
Disbeliever.description: You have experienced a dramatic revelation that has shattered your faith in Rokugani theology. Perhaps you believe that the Fortunes have no interest in mankind, or perhaps you have come to believe that the Tao of Shinsei holds nothing but empty promises. If your disbelief were made public knowledge, you would be shunned by all properly pious individuals everywhere, and any memberships you possess in temples or monastic orders would be instantly revoked. Your lack of piety makes you uncomfortable around shugenja and monks, and any Social Skill Rolls made with them have their TN increased by +5.
Disbeliever.output_text:
Your belief in Rokugani theology has been shattered. If your disbelief were known, you would be shunned by all properly pious individuals, and any memberships you possessed in temples or monastic orders would be instantly revoked.
Any Social Skill Rolls made with Shugenja or Monks have their TN increased by +5.

Disturbing Countenance.title: Disturbing Countenance
Disturbing Countenance.description: Something about your appearance causes others to respond to you with concern and caution. You are not necessarily unattractive, merely distubing in some way. The TN of all your Social Skill Rolls is increased by +5. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Spider characters.
Disturbing Countenance.output_text: The TN of all your Social Skill Rolls is increased by +5.

Doubt.title: Doubt
Doubt.description: Something has happened to cause you to question your training, so much so that it interferes with your ability to perform properly. Select one of your School Skills. Every time you use this Skill, you must declare one Raise that confers no benefit.
Doubt.output_text: Every time you use your {school_skill} skill (which is a School Skill), you must declare one Raise that confers no benefit.

Driven.title: Driven
Driven.description: You are possessed by some goal, and will sacrifice almost anything to accomplish it, even your honor. Family, friends, material possessions, and even Bushido mean nothing compared to the potential completion of this goal, whatever it may be.
Driven.output_text:
You are possessed by a goal, and will sacrifice anything to accomplish it. You are willing to sacrifice family, friends, material possessions, even your honor.
Goal: {goal}

Elemental Imbalance.title: Elemental Imbalance
Elemental Imbalance.description: The kami of one element favor you, but so much so that their voices sometimes overpower your will and cause your invocations to achieve results other than what you intended. Only shugenja may take this Disadvantage. Choose an element in which you do not possess a Deficiency. Whenever you cast a spell of this element, you must make a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 15 + 5 per rank of this Disadvantage. If you fail the roll, something disastrous happens. The spell may fail outright, it may target someone altogether different from who you intended, or other effects as determined by the GM.
Elemental Imbalance.output_text: Whenever you cast a {element[text]} spell, you must make a Willpower Trait Roll at TN £15 + 5 * {rank}£. If you fail, something disastrous happens with the spell, as determined by the GM.

Epilepsy.title: Epilepsy
Epilepsy.description: You possess a rare and poorly understood condition that causes you to experience seizures from time to time, consisting of a trance-like state, rigid muscle spasms, and frothing at the mouth. These are brought on by high stress or flashing lights, such as fireworks displays. Under such circumstances, you must succeed at a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 15 to avoid the seizure. If you fail, you experience a seizure and may roll a second Willpower Trait Roll (TN 10) each minute to end it. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to Crane characters.
Epilepsy.output_text:
When exposed to high levels of stress, or flashing lights such as fireworks displays, you must pass a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 15 to avoid falling into a Seizure. Seizure symptoms include a trance-like state, rigid muscle spasms and frothing at the mouth.
While in a seizure, you may roll a Willpower Trait Roll at TN 10 each minute, passing which will end the seizure.

Fascination.title: Fascination
Fascination.description: You are completely fascinated by some subject, and will go to great lengths to learn more about it or to experience it in new ways. Typical subjects of a samurai's fascination include music, horses, poetry, and history. This fascination badly impedes your judgement, and you will take even dishonorable actions to learn more, which could end in absolute disgrace if your actions are discovered.
Fascination.output_text:
You are completely fascinated by some subject, and will go to great lengths to learn more about it, even potentially risking your honor.
Fascination: {fascination}

Failure Of Bushido.title: Failure Of Bushido - {tenet[text]}
Failure Of Bushido.description: Try though you might to adhere to the code of bushido, one tenet in particular is simply foreign to you, and you have no concept of how to exemplify it through your actions. This Disadvantage is worth 1 additional point to ninja characters.

1.hovertext: You must spend a Void Point before you are able to act on behalf of someone of lower Status or social caste.

2.hovertext: When facing an opponent of higher Glory or Status, or when facing a Shadowlands opponent, the TN of all rolls you make is increased by +5.

3.hovertext: Any time you make a Social Skill Roll to apologize or avoid giving offense, you must call a Raise for no effect, or the roll will automatically fail.

4.hovertext: You cannot spend Void Points to negate Wounds.

5.hovertext: You cannot spend Void Points on any Sincerity (Honesty) Skill Roll, whether you have the Honesty Emphasis or not.

6.hovertext: You cannot add your Honor Rank to any roll to resist Intimidation or Temptation.

7.hovertext: Any time you are rolling the Sincerity Skill to convince someone of what you are saying, you must call an extra Raise for no effect, or the roll automatically fails.

Forced Retirement.title: Forced Retirement
Forced Retirement.description: You have been forced into early retirement by entering a monastery, perhaps due to political reasons or because of some public disgrace. You may not advance any further in yoru School. When you gain a new Insight Rank, you must instead begin taking ranks of an unaligned Monk School. You need not purchase the Multiple Schools Advantage for this. You are no longer considered a member of your Clan. This Disadvantage is worth 5 points to monk characters.
Forced Retirement.output_text:
You are no longer considered a member of your clan.
You may not advance any further in your School. When you gain a new Insight Rank, you must instead begin taking ranks of an unaligned Monk School (you don't need to take the Multiple Schools Advantage for this).

Frail Mind.title: Frail Mind
Frail Mind.description: You have difficulty concentrating, even when focusing your attention on an opponent. Whenever you make a Contested Roll using Willpower, your opponent gains a bonus of +2k0.
Frail Mind.output_text: Whenever you make a Contested Roll using Willpower, your opponent gains a bonus of +2k0.

Gaijin Name.title: Gaijin Name
Gaijin Name.description: Either due to your lineage, or your parents' fascination with another culture, you possess a name that is clearly not of Rokugani origin. Although there is no honor loss for such a thing, others regard you questionably as a result. Your individual dice may only explode once on a Social Skill Roll (that is, each die has a maximum possible result of 20). This Disadvantage is worth 2 points to Unicorn characters.
Gaijin Name.output_text: Your individual dice may only explode once on a Social Skill Roll (that is, each die has a maximum possible result of 20). This Disadvantage is worth 2 points to Unicorn characters.

Greedy.title: Greedy
Greedy.description: Material Wealth is more important to you than anything else, even though samurai are not meant to be sullied with commercial interests. Opponents attempting to use Temptation (Bribery) rolls against you gain a bonus of +1k1 to the total of the roll. This Disadvantage is worth 4 points to Mantis characters.
Greedy.output_text: Opponents attempting to use Temptation (Bribery) rolls against you gain a bonus of +1k1 to the total of the roll.

Gullible.title: Gullible
Gullible.description: Your trust is given easily and you place tremendous faith  in those whom you trust, unfortunately making it very simple for others to take advantage of your naive nature. Opponents attempting to use Sincerity (Deceit) rolls against you gain a bonus of +1k1 to the total of their rolls.
Gullible.output_text: Opponents attempting to use Sincerity (Deceit) rolls against you gain a bonus of +1k1 to the total of their rolls.

Haunted.title: Haunted
Haunted.description: One of your ancestors has chosen to bestow personal attention on you, constantly offering you advice and making demands. Perhaps the ancestor merely wishes you to live up to the ideals of your Clan and family, or perhaps they have some unfinished task or duty which they wish you to complete. You must show all due deference and respect to your ancestor, and do your best to live up to their expectations. If you fail to do so, your ancestor's disapproval will bring bad fortune upon you: so long as your ancestor remains angry, once per session one of your die rolls (chosen by the GM) will suffer a -1k1 penalty.
Haunted.output_text: One of your ancestors has chosen to follow you, constantly offering you advice and making demands. You must show all due deference and respect to your ancestor, and do your best to live up to their demands. If you fail, your ancestor's disapproval will bring bad fortune upon you: once per session, your GM will choose one of your die rolls to be hit with a -1k1 penalty, as long as your ancestor is angry.

Hostage.title: Hostage
Hostage.description: In the resolution between Clans, it is not uncommon for hostages to be exchanged as 'guests' of one another's Clans for a specified amount of time. This ensures that the treaty in question is not broken. Although you are treated respectfully and as a guest in the lands of another Clan, you are not permitted to leave without escort and, should war break out between your Clan and your hosts, your life will be forfeit.
Hostage.output_text: You are a 'guest' of another Clan, to ensure a peace treaty is not broken. You are treated respectfully and as a guest, but you are not permitted to leave without escort, and if war should break out between your Clan and your host, your life will be forfeit.

Idealistic.title: Idealistic
Idealistic.description: You adhere closely to the code of Bushido, perhaps too closely, and you have a hopelessly naive view of the world and how things work. You have impossible standards that not even the most heroic individual could hope to meet, much less you. Whenever you lose Honor, the loss is increased by 1 point. This Disadvantage is worth 3 points to Lion characters.
Idealistic.output_text: Whenever you lose Honor, the loss is increased by 1 point.

Infamous.title: Infamous
Infamous.description: You are well known in some circles, but not in the manner you might wish. Rather than being known for your valor and your courage, you are known for being ruthless, cruel, and dangerous. This reputation may not be deserved, but it is widespread enough that it no longer matters if it is true. Your starting Glory Rank is replaced with an Infamy Rank, which serves in exactly the same capacity, save for the reaction of those who recognise you.
Infamous.output_text: Instead of Glory, you now have Infamy Ranks, granting you a reputation for being ruthless, cruel, and dangerous.
